xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class HybridKernelCDF

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double>
      xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
          xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.AbstractKernelCDF
              xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.HybridKernelCDF
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Function<java.lang.Number,java.lang.Double>, RealFunction, WindowQuery
public class HybridKernelCDF
extends AbstractKernelCDF

This class provides an implementation of a kernel based estimator for a cumulative distribution function (cdf). based upon a simple random sample for data given by objects of type Number. The estimator is updatable, so one can use it as an aggregate function combined with a special aggregation iterator.
This class implements a special kind of kernel cdf estimators using a hybrid technique first performed by Blohsfeld et. al. in
[BKS99]: Bjoern Blohsfeld, Dieter Korus, Bernhard Seeger: A Comparison of Selectivity Estimators for Range Queries on Metric Attributes. SIGMOD Conference 1999: 239-250.
Generally, a set of separate kernel based cdf estimators is given whereas each one is assigned to a partial interval respectively bin. The bins in turn build a partition of the x-Axis. There, the borders should correspond to change points of the estimated pdf. These change points can be estimated, if they are not a priori known. The estimators of the bins are kernel cdf estimators using reflection as a boundary treatment. See ReflectionKernelCDFEstimator for details about using reflection.

The estimator is implemented as a one-dimensional function expecting objects of type Number as well as a RealFunction expecting data of type double. A sample of any kind of data given by an iterator could be easily obtained through the reservoir sampler cursor.

See Also:
Aggregator, Iterator, Function, KernelFunction, KernelBandwidths, AbstractKernelDensityEstimator, NativeKernelDensityEstimator, ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator, NativeKernelDensityEstimator.FACTORY, ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator.FACTORY, Serialized Form

Field Detail

FACTORY

public static Function FACTORY
Provides a factory for a hybrid kernel distribution estimator. The parameters needed for construction are passed to the factory by an Object[] o containing:
o[0]: used kernel function
o[1]: used sample as Object[] containing numerical data
o[2]: indicates the type of the used bandwidths as Object of type Integer
o[3]: minimum of the data space as Object of type Number
o[4]: maximum of the data space as Object of type Number
o[5]: used bin borders to build up the estimator given as Objects of type Number

min

protected double min
minimum of the data (estimated or computed), i.e., left border of the data

max

protected double max
maximum of the data (estimated or computed), i.e., right border of the data

changePoints

protected java.lang.Object[] changePoints
border points of the used partitioning of type Number, so called change points

hs

protected double[] hs
bandwidth for every bin. If set to null automatic smoothing will be performed

binEstimators

protected Function[] binEstimators
functions estimating the assigned bin

cdfEstimatorFactory

protected Function cdfEstimatorFactory
factory delivering the estimators used for the bins

lastUsedFunction

protected int lastUsedFunction
index of last used estimator

binSamples

protected java.lang.Object[] binSamples
sample assigned to the enclosing bins

automaticBandwidthMode

protected boolean automaticBandwidthMode
indicates whether the bandwidths are computed based upon the normal scale rule using the sample. If set to false, the bandwidths needed to be given by the user

bandwidthType

protected int bandwidthType
used type of bandwidth

HybridKernelCDF

public HybridKernelCDF(KernelFunction kf,
                       java.lang.Object[] sample,
                       int bandwidthType,
                       double min,
                       double max,
                       java.lang.Object[] changePoints,
                       Function cdfEstimatorFactory)
Constructs an estimator for a cdf using the given kernel function by defining separate estimators for a well-defined partition of the x-axis.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function.
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
bandwidthType - type of bandwidth used in automatic mode normal scale rule will be performed
min - left border of the data space
max - right border of the data space
changePoints - points where to "break" the sample
cdfEstimatorFactory - a factory delivering kernel estimators used for the bins

public HybridKernelCDF(KernelFunction kf,
                       java.lang.Object[] sample,
                       int bandwidthType,
                       double min,
                       double max,
                       java.lang.Object[] changePoints)
Constructs an estimator for a cdf using the given kernel function by defining separate estimators for a well-defined partition of the x-axis. The factory delivers reflection kernel based cdf's.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function.
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
bandwidthType - type of bandwidth used in automatic mode normal scale rule will be performed.
min - left border of the data space
max - right border of the data space
changePoints - points where to "break" the sample

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function.
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type Number.
hs - used bandwidths for the bins. If set to null automatic smoothing using the normal scale rule will be performed.
min - left border of the data space
max - right border of the data space
changePoints - points where to "break" the sample
cdfEstimatorFactory - a factory delivering kernel estimators used for the bins

setChangePoints

public void setChangePoints(java.lang.Object[] cp)
Sets the new change points ,e.g., the data points determining the bins. If the number of used change points needs to be changed do it first, than give the new bandwidths or set to automatic.

Parameters:
cp - new change points used for partitioning

setBandwidths

public void setBandwidths(double[] newBandwidths)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets the new used bandwidths. If the number of used change points needs to be changed, the new change points must be given BEFORE updating the bandwidths or an IllegalArgumentException occurs. The given bandwidths are used in the given order corresponding to the ascending ordered bins.

Parameters:
newBandwidths - new bandwidths to use. If set to null automatic smoothing is enabled.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bandwidths does not correspond to the number of bins used for estimation (the number of change points +1)

setBandwidthType

public void setBandwidthType(int newBandwidthType)
Switches to automatic bandwidth mode and sets the used strategy to obtain the bandwidths needed.

Parameters:
newBandwidthType - new strategy for computing the bandwidths

reinit

protected void reinit()
Reinitilizes the estimator after changes

Overrides:
reinit in class AbstractKernelCDF
